title: Nduka Boika
text: Hello! I’m Nduka Boika, a doctoral student in Educational Psychology at the University of North Texas and a Graduate Student Assistant with the Office of Research Consulting. Here I share reflections and hands-on applications of the methods I’m learning. This is my first website, so it’s a work in progress and will improve over time. My current interests include Structural Equation Modeling (SEM), Hierarchical Linear Modeling (HLM), and meta-analysis. If you have resources—books, articles, conferences, webinars, or trainings—please reach out at Nduka.boika@unt.edu. In my free time, I enjoy movies and soccer.

title: Data wrangling with data.frame
text: Data is as important as the statistical methods used to analyse the data. Infact some statistical methods were developed based on data structures. An example is multilevel models for longitudinal and multilevels data. However, before you can use the data in statistical analysis it has to be valid or clean. For this tutorial, we will use the data.table package in R.

title: Data wrangling with data.frame
text:
Load libraries
Firstly we want to load the necessary libraries. library(data.table) and library(NHANES). NHANES is the dataset we will use for this tutorial.

You must install a package before you can load it. For example, to install the data.table package, run install.packages("data.table").


library(data.table)
#View(eurosoccer)
library(NHANES)

title: Data wrangling with data.frame
text:
Explore the dataset

nhanes <- data.table(NHANES)
tables(nhanes) # gives the lists of data.tables with dimension information.

     NAME  NROW NCOL                                           COLS    KEY
1: nhanes 10000   76 ID,SurveyYr,Gender,Age,AgeDecade,AgeMonths,... [NULL]
